default: ^I think you - you didnt set a proper stitch?
^Idk to each their own , just take it away now.

b: ^Well, what do you make of it, Detective?
^It all points to an intruder, yeah. Whoever made the noise complaint probably heard something legit.
^The plot thickens!! Shall we check inside?
^Here we are! Kettle Rock's pride and joy. Best wine north of California.
^You said this place closed a few weeks ago? It looks like it's been abandoned for years.
^Well, it has been a bit neglected recently. But make no mistake, this is a piece of town history!
^It's obscure. Someone was definitely here, but I can't speak to motive. Who would want to break into an abandoned Winery?
^That sounds like it's time for some profiling! We need a suspect list.
^Any leads on who it could be?
^Our best bet is questioning some locals.
^Oh, right! Yeah, of course you don't. Follow me.
^Wow. The inside is so much better than the outside.
^Never judge a book by it's cover!
^That was sarcasm, you know that, right?
^[Misra] I'm sorry if Roy seems like a bit of a downer.
^[Lupe] He seems like he's got a pretty good acceptance of the situation.
^[Misra] Well, you've only been here a day...
^[Misra] Good luck getting anything out of them.
^It's good to see you too, Uncle.
^Meh. Not very good. But I am used to it by now.
^We're just asking a few questions about a disturbance last night.
^Of course, in anyway that I can.
^Feel free to look around, if it helps any.

personal_info: ^Well, I was born and raised here in Kettle Rock.
^When my parent's moved away, he became my guardian.
^I begged and begged for Misra to leave, too.
town_history: ^As I'm sure you've noticed, it's not in the best shape.
^Lots of places shutting down, going out of business.
^I think it's just unsustainable as it is.
^I know you don't like to hear it, but it's the truth.
^You stepped up as Sheriff once the rest of the force retired to take care of this place
^but it seems to me like it might be time to move on.
^Someone's got to try and turn things around.
winery_closing: ^Ah, the straw that broke the camels back.
^It finally shut down, about a month ago.
^I have no idea what will become of it.
^There are only so many things you can do with an old Winery.
window: ^You have a perfect view of the Winery from here.
^It's not much to look at these days.
^Did you...see anything out of place, last night?
^We're investigating a break in that happened.
^Ay, Misra, you should not be poking around up there.
^Any ideas on who would want to break in and trash the place?
merch_shirt: ^Really leaning into that small town appeal, I see.
^Believe it or not, those used to fly off the shelves.
^I'd sell out of them one month, and then by the month after, I couldn't pay people to touch them.
merch_sticker: ^I feel like you'd need witchcraft to get these things to sell.

c-0: ^Dios Mio; that was a hard time.
^Although I'd argue that we've fallen on harder times now.
^So optimistic, and I love you for that.
^The Rocky Years was a time of inconsistency.
^We would flourish for the first part of the decade and struggle the latter.
^Disease of an unexplained nature swept through town.
^It was. I do not miss that time.
c-1: ^Folk around here speak ill of them, but don't listen.
^Certain people even like to gossip, call them names,
^insinuate that there was something else going on.
^Nothing real, and nothing worth talking about.
c-2: ^The Winery sales were good, tourism was up.
^people recovered from whatever mysterious disease had passed over us.
^It was a good time, but it's over now.
^For now. Good times will come again!
^Sometimes, the good times are just behind us.

b: ^I'd say those troublemakers down at the Arcade.

teenagers: ^We spoke to the teens at Power Up.
^Jenny still giving you a hard time?
^They denied having anything to do with the Winery.
^They did point us towards a "Jenkins Tomm".
^I'm not sure he'll be any help to you.
^Really, Misra, I think you two should leave this alone.
^We've got to get to the bottom of this!

b: ^I've already told you what I know.
^And I'm not the one blocking you from your high score.
^I wanted to learn a little more about the town.
^I can tell when someone's lying, you know.
^I just want to ask you a few questions.
^You're still mad about the HO:SI thing?

KR_Jenny: ^Small ass town in the middle of nowhere.
^I noticed that there's not too many people around.
^Yeah, all the sane people have moved away in the last few years.
^but she isn't sure where we would go.
^Eh. This town is full of crazies and people stuck in denial.
winery_jenny: ^It seemed kinda important, to like, the town
^I mean, the stupid Goats sure liked it up there.

b: ^Someone told us that you guys like to hang around up there.
^You know, I have knack for when someone's not telling me the whole truth, too.
^I've never set foot inside that place.

jenny_suspects: ^Say I wanted to learn more about the Winery...anyone been talking about it lately?

b: ^Can you, uh, speak a little slower?
^Hey man, can you turn that down a bit?
^You must not have anything important to say, then.
^I can just talk to your friends, then.
^You probably don't matter as much, anyway.
^Josh turns down the music a bit.

hosi: ^They've been trying to beat it for a while now.
^What does that have to do with anything?
^It's the only game in here they don't have the high score on.

s0: ^Look, unless you want to talk about HOSI, we're done.

b: ^I just want to ask you a few questions.
^You're still mad about the HO:SI thing?

hosi: ^They've been trying to beat it for a while now.
^What does that have to do with anything?
^It's the only game in here they don't have the high score on.

^I wanted to learn a little more about the town.
^I can tell when someone's lying, you know.
^Small ass town in the middle of nowhere.
^I noticed that there's not too many people around.
^Yeah, all the sane people have moved away in the last few years.
^but she isn't sure where we would go.
^Eh. This town is full of crazies and people stuck in denial.
^It seemed kinda important, to like, the town
^I mean, the stupid Goats sure liked it up there.
^Someone told us that you guys like to hang around up there.
^You know, I have knack for when someone's not telling me the whole truth, too.
^I've never set foot inside that place.
^Are you talking about the people who disappeared in 1940?
^Mom tells me to not speak ill of the dead.
^Hey man, can you turn that down a bit?
^You must not have anything important to say, then.
^I can just talk to your friends, then.
^You probably don't matter as much, anyway.
^Josh turns down the music a bit.
^I'D SAY JENKINS, BUT HE'S PROBABLY TOO DRUNK TO TELL YOU ANYTHING.

4_3_KR_josh: ^Everything's been closing, not like there was much to begin with.
^It's okay, we'll get back on our feet.
4_3_winery_josh: ^What does that have to do with anything?

b: ^You wouldn't have happened to go up there recently?
^These folks have some questions for you.
^I ain't got nothin to say to the Rookie Sheriff.
^You answer their questions or I'm closing your tab.
^The hell do you want to know?

s0: ^Man, how much do you have to drink to be knocked out that bad?
s1: ^ That's gonna hurt when he comes to.

jenkins_questions: ^You wouldn't have happened to be up there last night?
^That's the second time I've heard the word 'sacrifice' tossed around. Are you talking about the people who vanished? The ..Council?
jenkins_winery_: ^Will I ever stop hearing about the godforsaken place?
^S'worth nothing but the dirt it stands on.
jenkins_last_night: ^You haven't been up there lately, then?
^I'm reminded of 'em everytime I set foot in the building.
^I feel like they can still hear them...
jenkins_kettle_rock: ^All that blood sunk into this town.
^All that blood turned into fleeting money.
^Was it worth it, do you think?
jenkins_council: ^The Council was s'much more than that.
^Their sacrifice s'not somethin to throw away,
jenkins_sarah: ^End of the line, ship s'goin down.
^I-I don't know who you're talking about.
jenkins_sacrifice: ^That's what this town slaps over the truth.
^We're starting to pick up some steam with this.

b: ^Let me know if you need anything.
^People have been mentioning goats a lot.
^Someone's drawn on your memorial plaque over there.
^How long have you lived in Kettle Rock?
^What do you know about the Old Winery?
^Despite all the closed shops and stores, this place is still open...

irene_goats: ^I get the feeling they're not talking about the animal.
^Misra, you haven't filled them in on this?
^If it's important to the case, I should know.
^The people who disappeared in the tragedy.
^It's just silly town folklore meant to scare kids and give people a reason to gossip.
^They call them "Goats" because people think they sacrificied themselves.
irene_plaque: ^I'll clean it off when I close up.
irene_sacrifice: ^Who better to be interested in a small town mystery than a Detective?
^That's not the case we're working on, though.
^I'm sure Misra's told you about Kettle Rock's rocky past?
^Well, legend says that in order to save the town, in desperation, a group of locals turned to darker alternatives.
^I don't know if they were dancin' with the Devil,
^or one of the many demons that want to sink their fangs into humanity's naviety,
^but they were in kahoots with something of that nature.
^And one day in 1940, when it came time to pay up and face the music...
^I feel like you've given that speech before
^Hey, I gotta keep the drunks entertained somehow.
irene_kettle_rock: ^I actually when to highschool with Misra.
^But I'm sure you know that already.
irene_winery: ^Sheesh, that old shack on the hill?
^More trouble than it's worth, in my opinion.
^There was a break in, it looks like.
^Heck, what are you talking to me for?
^You should be talking to Jenkins over there.
^He worked at the place for years.
^Would he have any reason to go up there and trash the place?
^Hell, I don't know. But I can tell you he's been here every night for the past week. Hasn't budged from his Whiskey Neat.
^But why don't you ask him yourselves?
^Give him a good shove, and he'll come to.
^I've done it a dozen times when he passes out like this.
irene_still_standing: ^It's a little concerning that the bar is one of
^the businesses that is still able to stay afloat.
^People need somewhere to forget about their troubles, I guess.
^To be honest, I've been debating closing up shop myself.
^Yeah; Roy offered to buy me out.
^Says he'll pay me up front for the place, too.
^I'm not the only person he's made this offer too.
^He bought out the Diner, I'm pretty sure.

thelton: ^You've reached Chief Detective Inspector Thelton, Boise Precinct. I'm not available right now. You know what to do!

^Hey, it's Lupe. Had to change my route; tank was running low. I pit stopped outside of Kettle Rock, Idaho. Should be back on the road soon--don't jump on me for being late. I'll debrief the Watchowski Case with you when I get back. Alright. Bye.

b: ^"Sorry I was so late to the debrief boss, I had to go report a suspicious fallen tree."
^Ugh. Guess I'll be more than a little late...
^Thelton's gonna kill me. Gah. Let's blow this popsicle stand.
^"Out of order. Pay inside." Of course. Just my luck.
^Let's get this over with. Sooner I pay, sooner I can get back on the road, sooner Thelton won't bite my head off.
^... Why am I still looking at this gas pump?
^.. This gas pump is kind of freaky.
^I should really go pay for gas.
^"Sorry I was so late to the debrief boss, I had to go report a suspicious fallen tree." Ugh. Guess I'll be more than a little late...Thelton's gonna kill me.
^Timber. Heh heh. Hope you didn't need to be anywhere anytime soon.
^...great. Any way I can get this fixed?
^If you put in a complaint with the local Police I'm sure you'll be out of here in no time.
^You're stuck at the pump too, eh? Good luck getting that lazybones to help you. Heh. Youth these days, am I right?

enter_store: ^I guess I'll find someone to help me inside here.

s0: ^Sugar-Flavored Snack Bites. Pickle Chips. Jerkied Ox Sticks...I think I'll pass.
s2: ^ I though Pop Pops Gum went out of production in the 90s? Weird.

b: ^Mel said to hit it. In the side.
^I work at a gas station. How do you think I am?
^...The pump's broken. It says to pay inside?
^Yeahhhhh. You can't pay right now. The register drawer is busted
^I've got no reason to poke around.
^Mel's the name. What are you doing back here?
^I need to pay for gas. The cash register is broken.
^The drawer is just jammed, it just needs to be whacked in the side a bit

s0: ^Look, I'd like to help more, but I gotta get this stuff out.
s2: ^ It almost looks like mold? Or jello. Gross, ain't it?
s3: ^ I love my job. I love my job. Ugh.

goop: ^No idea, it was here when I unlocked this morning.

b: ^Seems like the fence has been cut through. That gap looks just big enough for a person...
^Hm. I'd say this is a pretty solid piece of evidence.
^Yeah, it's definitely been broken by force. But something about this seems off to me...
^Maybe they didn't want to leave shoe prints?
^Footprints at the scene of the crime. Classic.

inside_window: ^Something about this broken window doesn't make sense to me...
handprint: ^Well, someone didn't care about leaving behind evidence.
^Do you have a lab here in Kettle Rock?
claw_marks: ^Some kind of animal, maybe? Maybe a raccoon is our culprit.
floor_splatters: ^I know what you're thinking! Don't worry, it's not blood. I'm sure you've already deduced this, but it's dried up wine from when this place was used.
equipment: ^Some of this stuff looks like it's been ripped apart.
wine_barrels: ^Back in the day, this place really did make good wine.
^Is any of that wine left in there?
^Are you asking if I want to get a drink?
^...It would just be a motive, if anyone was looking to take some.
^Oh, no. They drained all of it when the Winery closed.
^I don't drink when I'm on a case.
^I know, I know. Professional, as always.
door_office: ^To one of the backrooms. It was locked when the Winery shut down, and is still locked.
^So they wouldn't have been able to access that room?

b: ^We probably shouldn't leave just yet! More investigating to do!

scene4_1: ^Lupe and Misra find themselves on the Main Street of Kettle Rock, in front of a Fountain.
^The General Store and Arcade are accessible.
^Any store marked with a closed sign is not accessible.
^"The Heart of Kettle Rock" seems a bit...barren.

misra_cutscene: ^[Misra] Kettle Rock, Main Street. Heart of the Downtown.
^[Misra] There's bound to be some locals around - where do you want to start?

s1: ^ I don't think it's anything important.

b: ^Hm. Looks like some sort of silly engravement.
^It was at the Gas Station near the edge of town.
^Looks like the Bar is open! Shall we?
^I still need to drive back out tonight once the road is cleared.
^I forgot to tell you, but the earliest I can get someone out there to clear the tree is tomorrow morning.
^I know you had somewhere to be.
^But I suppose there's nothing you can do about it.
^Think of it this way...we get more time to crack this case!
^But in the meantime, let's take a bit of a break...
^The Rockin Kettle doesn't open until happy hour!

einab_closed_sign: ^A lot of things seem to be closed...
heart_of_kettle: ^Usually it's busy and full of life,
^but things have been bumpy for a lot of locals lately,
^Not enough profit to keep them going.

pamphlet: ^Wow, it's a pamphlet w/ loads of info!

b: ^I don't recognize any of these games.
^They're all knock offs of knock offs.

teens_roulette: ^Say I wanted to learn more about the Winery...anyone been talking about it lately?
exit_scene: ^Unless the Rookie Sheriff wants to conceit their HO:SI score, no.

scene4_4: ^Only accessible after Gen Store and Arcade have been visited

goop: ^You've been getting this stuff too, huh?
^It's been coming up out of the drains like crazy.
^It's annyoing, but it comes off easy enough.
^I just dump all the bleach I've got in the backroom on it and poof!
memorial_plaque: ^Lupe leans close to a memorial plaque on the wall. It reads "In Memory of those lost in the Tragedy of 1940. Rest in Peace, Never Forgotten." Over the corner of it, someone has sharpied over it with "THOSE STUPID GOATS!"
